ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Insufficient OSPL90 (Output Saturation)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: The C4-Passion device had a significantly lower OSPL90 (108 dB SPL) compared to the patient's previous Diva 9 (125 dB SPL), causing saturation and clipping of loud speech peaks.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Input Stage Saturation
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered but unlikely as both devices use 16-bit ADCs with similar dynamic ranges, and directional microphones typically reduce input levels.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Signal Processing Differences
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Unlikely to be the cause as gain settings for soft/normal sounds were matched and noise reduction algorithms were similar between devices.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To confirm current hearing thresholds and configuration.
To compare the electroacoustic characteristics (gain and OSPL90) of the new versus old hearing aids.
To objectively evaluate and compare speech recognition performance in noise with different devices.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometric testing confirmed a flat moderate-severe SNHL. Verification showed that while gain for soft/average inputs was matched between devices, the new C4-Passion had insufficient OSPL90 (108 dB SPL) compared to the previous Diva 9 (125 dB SPL), leading to saturation. Comparative HINT testing demonstrated that this lack of headroom significantly degraded performance in noise (+2 dB SNR) compared to the old aids (-2 dB SNR), whereas the proposed C4-FS model restored and improved performance (-3 dB SNR).

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Flat sensorineural hearing loss at 60 dB HL.

tests.name: Hearing Instrument Verification
tests.result_summary: C4-Passion OSPL90 (108 dB SPL) was significantly lower than Diva 9 (125 dB SPL); frequency output matched at 50 and 65 dB inputs.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise (HINT)
tests.result_summary: RTS results: Diva 9 (-2 dB SNR), C4-Passion (+2 dB SNR), C4-FS (-3 dB SNR). Estimated 30-50% improvement with C4-FS over C4-Passion.

proposed_items: Fit Widex CLEAR Fusion (C4-FS) RIC hearing aids with P-receiver
Ensure OSPL90 is comparable to previous devices (approx. 118-124 dB SPL)
counseling_actions: Explain that the 'muffled' sound is due to the smaller hearing aid clipping loud speech peaks because of insufficient power (OSPL90)
Advise that the C4-FS model provides the necessary power to match previous performance while remaining cosmetically discreet
Discuss HINT results showing a potential 30-50% improvement in speech recognition with the proposed device

escalation.rationale_short: Proceed with fitting the proposed higher-power RIC devices.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Next day and again in 2 weeks
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor patient satisfaction, sound quality perception, and speech recognition in noise.

expected_outcome: Patient reported an improvement in sound quality.
Speech with the C4-FS was reportedly clearer and more natural than with the Diva 9 and C4-Passion.
Patient reported a more three-dimensional perception of his listening environments.
Confirmed initial satisfaction and reported excellent sound quality and better speech recognition in noisy background.
